definition: hammer drill for boring through rock
a drill/a hammer drill for boring through rock/same as 釺子|钎子

sentences.english: The brazed rate is an important parameter represented product quality.
sentences.chinese: 钎着率是判断钎焊质量的重要指标。

sentences.english: A core drill bit consists of a steel tube with diamond segments brazed or laser welded on the drilling end.
sentences.chinese: 核心钻头由一钢管或激光焊接金刚石钎环节就完钻。

sentences.english: Steel rods, hammers and the Red Flag Canal spirit.
sentences.chinese: 靠钎和锤，还有红旗渠精神。

definition: short slender pointed piece of metal, bamboo etc/skewer/prod used to extract samples from sacks of grain etc/(dialect) to stick in/to bolt (a door)/to arrange (flowers in a vase)/to graft (tree)/to pedicure/to peel (an apple etc)
hammer drill for boring through rock
ice spud (aka ice chisel) with a pointy tip/to break a hole in ice (for ice fishing etc) using an ice spud
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
ancient weapon with a tip shaped like a hand or claw
ice spud (aka ice chisel) with a pointy tip
